website_summaries.verdict: Low price for a 50-foot soaker garden hose that flattens after use for easy storage.
pros: Available in lengths of 25, 50, or 75 feet
Works equally well aboveground or slightly buried under soil or mulch
cons: Hose may leak in the seam where connector and hose meet

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hose for not for drip style irrigation of flower beds, etc.
customer_reviews.text: works well for watering closely spaced arrangements of various plants. Just snake the hose back and forth through the plants so each gets some watering inside the drip line. The hose leaks slowly at full water flow from the faucet so the water get absorbed directly into the ground without running off. The hose can be twisted with no kinking so the water continues regardless of the way you snake across a bed. The hose is perfect for watering those plantings for which a sprinkler cannot be efficiently configured to water just the plants and not surrounding areas that you do not want to water.
customer_reviews.author: Dayzee D

customer_reviews.title: Good at first
customer_reviews.text: At first the hoses worked well. I was very pleased. In a very short time, several of the hoses developed problems. The water sprayed out in one place on the hose and soaked one small area too much. This should not happen this soon after beginning to use them.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Not for winding around plants
customer_reviews.text: I had such high hopes for this soaker hose but there are a couple of issues. First and foremost, it's probably best used for straight stretches. Winding it through my garden resulted in folds or kinks that would impede water flow. Second, there are a couple of spots where it leaks. The water still gets beyond the leaks, but a lot of water comes out at certain places. Without the leaks, and used straight, it's probably fine.
customer_reviews.author: M. Moore

customer_reviews.title: BEST DRIP HOSE I've ever used!
customer_reviews.text: I used a hose like this deep watering fruit trees and iris/ground-covers around them. This style is the BEST DRIP HOSE I've ever used! for a steady medium to heavy drip. Doesn't clog up like the porous rubber soaker hose does. Mine lasted for about 8 to 10 years, leaving it out summer and winter (mild, New Mexico winter - it freezes, but not heavy) above ground but mostly burried under heavy mulch or under the leaves of ground-cover plants. Loved it, time for another!
customer_reviews.author: Still Shopping

customer_reviews.title: Cannot believe these would get a bad review
customer_reviews.text: I've used every kind of soaker hose in the past and this is absolutely the best, imho. The others shot water up into the air not on the ground where I needed the water to soak into. This is super flexible and easy to lay out, weaving all through my flower beds. When I decided to look for a soaker hose recently, I went online to look for reviews and this one was rated #1, to which I whole heartedly agree.
customer_reviews.author: D. W.

customer_reviews.title: Leaks at connection and broke after 11 months
customer_reviews.text: This pos didn't even last a season. It doesn't spray misty streams like traditional soaker hoses, so it just soaks under the hose. It leaks from the joiner at the connection to the house and it just sprung a leak towards the end that has just made it unusable. Non traditional design makes repairs improbable? I have no idea how to start. It has a rubber tube inside a nylon tube...? I thought by spending more I was getting more. Nope... My other expensive Melnor sprinkler is also starting to fail as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mark F

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Is working perfectly for me. I have two of the 50 foot and a 75 footer. MUCH preferred to the round hoses that either drip too much or not enough! I use with a shutoff valve accessory which lets me set the amount of drippage I prefer for around my house. Dripping even varies depending on whether the seam or the round edge is down. I like that it allows you to twist the hose below the attachment end to avoid kinks. Haven't tried burying it under mulch this year, but I don't anticipate difficulty next. I will of course take them up during the freezing weather.
customer_reviews.author: Liz H

customer_reviews.title: Soaking new bushes
customer_reviews.text: I just had 14 new bushes put in, 3' on center. I run 2 connected hoses down to the bushes and connect the soaker to the end of them. I then run the hose straight across all the bushes. I feel a lot of problems one might have with this soaker is kinks in the line since the hose feels like it has a very flexible, probably silicone inner tube inside. For my straight run, this hose served its purpose thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Don’t let it kink or you’ll break it
customer_reviews.text: It works well for the most part, just make sure you have it completely laid out with no kinks when you first turn it on, THEN weave it through your garden. Just one kink in the early part of the hose will burst the seems and give you a major hole. I caused a major hole on the first use.
customer_reviews.author: MorningSun

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Item
customer_reviews.text: No more hand watering in 105-degree weather, no more hours and hours fussing with hoses. This soaker hose is a game changer and I will never do without it again. I've used this brand for two summers, both with three months of heat above 100 degrees. They still work great. They store easily for winter. They are light as air compared to handling traditional hoses and are easy to wind through garden beds.
customer_reviews.author: Chalyse

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Only lasted 2 or 3 uses.
customer_reviews.text: At first this hose was great, super flexible and easy to put away after use. The second time I started leaking near the end where the handle was. The thrid time it was like a tiger had chewed on it. The pipe was leaking all up and down the pipe. Now it loses so much water that the water coming out of the end barely has any pressure. Avoid and get some other hose.
customer_reviews.author: Assad

customer_reviews.title: Not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great for about a month, then I believe it split at the side on the outter jacket where I believe it is where it is sewn together. I think this can be fixed but I ordered this because I bought a crapo cheap one at menards that I stopped using as soon as this one came in.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Bartosiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Broke near attachment after about 30 uses.
customer_reviews.text: Hose didn't make it a full season. The seams are split near the attachment as others have experienced. I'm hoping they at least replace it as they say they stand by their product.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Gently

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: I set this soaker hose up with a timer, and it works great, delivering even watering to the area for the whole length of the hose. The water oozes out of the hose. It does not shoot or sprinkle. The only improvement might be to make it more flexible without kinking, but with careful manipulation it can be somewhat adjustable. Would recommend, and will probably buy another when I need one.
customer_reviews.author: Blessed One

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous soaker hose
customer_reviews.text: This hose is really easy to handle, in contrast to round rubber soaker hoses which won't lie flat, curl in annoying ways, and are bulky to store. This one lies flat in storage and when empty, is easy to lay out and collect, releases the water beautifully and evenly, and never fights with you the way round soaker hoses do.
customer_reviews.author: S. Reid

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: The first order came with broken connector second order leaks at the connector. Bad reviews online never should have bought. Will return
customer_reviews.author: Michael A.

customer_reviews.title: Leaks...Find a better hose...
customer_reviews.text: Hose worked fine but sprung a leak in its 5th use. Find a better hose...
customer_reviews.author: Lashes

customer_reviews.title: My preference
customer_reviews.text: I have used a lot of different style soaker hoses over the years. This is the easiest to work with and seems more durable
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: lasted 2 seasons
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this soaker hose in July 2017. We only got the remainder of 2017 and 2018 with this hose. Last year we had no garden. This year, water just flooded out of it. I twas drained and garage kept over winter in NJ.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: No lack of water dripping through this!
customer_reviews.text: Drips pretty well. I prefer the round after using one of each. The dirt doesn’t muck up as badly to the round drip line and it doesn’t kink up so much but inch you’ve gotten your bed all planted and it’s down and in place it’s fine. Sure puts out the water!!
customer_reviews.author: JeanDucksfan

customer_reviews.title: Good for dry weather
customer_reviews.text: We have had no rain for so long, every day watering by hand was just not working. This appears to be a good solution for our grapes. I ordered another for my garden.
customer_reviews.author: Suwanneelady9

customer_reviews.title: This soaker hose is very lightweight and easy to tote around
customer_reviews.text: This soaker hose is very lightweight and easy to tote around. It does an excellent job of watering as it lets a lot of water seep out. And, very easy to add another hose to it. I bought a second one that was 25 ft for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent soaker hose! Have used it for more than one season and it’s still going strong! I just ordered a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Scenicroutesal

customer_reviews.title: Garden kept moist during hot summer vacation!
customer_reviews.text: This soaker hose kept my raised garden healthy and well watered for 8 hot sunny August days while we were on vacation. I just turned the faucet down to a slow drip, and it worked perfectly. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: nacare49

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a great hose
customer_reviews.text: I love these hoses - we have 5 of them. Three of them have lasted 3 years outside in all the elements (until I accidentally cut a hole in two of them - beware, they are very easy to cut). Great price for a great hose.
customer_reviews.author: C. Rundquist

customer_reviews.title: Earliest way towater new plantings in your yard!
customer_reviews.text: Great, inexpensive but good quality garden soaker. Because it’s so pliable, we can wind it back and forth through our new boxwood hedge for perfect watering, especially through this searingly hot summer?
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Goldenstein

customer_reviews.title: Melnor Flat Soaker Garden hose, 50ft
customer_reviews.text: Hello: sorry to say this soaker hose lasted a month at best, then started coming apart and leaking gallons of water when in use. the edge stitching did not hold so there would be large quantities of water in some areas and none in others.
customer_reviews.author: Judy A. Elrite

customer_reviews.title: Tons better than the recycled alternative!
customer_reviews.text: These work hundred times better than the recycled round soaker alternative. Can cut to fit & these work great if layed out without sharp turns. Read reviews about how people extend longer lengths with different techniques by adjusting the in-line pressure.
customer_reviews.author: DWD

customer_reviews.title: Last a month then started leaking in first foot or so by connection
customer_reviews.text: Similar to what was reported by others.. excessive leakage near connection point and in the first 12-18"
customer_reviews.author: Steven R.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.........
customer_reviews.text: It's okay, yes, but it is very difficult to untangle when you start the water pressure.............takes too much time and effort to untwist and get it to produce the water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy, effective and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: Great hose for the money. Occasionally some drips are tiny sprays but a small rearranging redirects it. Perf3ct timimg when I purchased as we had bad drought for 6 weeks
customer_reviews.author: NJseabreeze

customer_reviews.title: faulty hose
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 4 of these and one has a terrible leak. It says there is a 2 year warranty but when I contacted the seller they faulty hoses were handled through Amazon. How do I get a replacement? The order says window for exchanges is closed after one month. Where is the 2 year warranty?
customer_reviews.author: marsha f

customer_reviews.title: 2 hoses hooked together don't produce enough pressure
customer_reviews.text: I needed 2 hoses to do all of the watering. There just wasn't enough pressure to reach the to other hose. Our water pressure is great, just don't know much about soakers hoses. But, the one hose is great for the money. We are using just one and it is working out for us.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for now
customer_reviews.text: Good water distribution throughout the hose. The threads to connect to water are cheap and mine leaks
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: I was a bit wary since I read mixed reviews on this but I've been using it for several weeks and it is the best soaker I've had
customer_reviews.text: I have not had any trouble with it at all. I was a bit wary since I read mixed reviews on this but I've been using it for several weeks and it is the best soaker I've had. Way easier to use and store than those rubbery ones. I'd buy it again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Good for a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for 2 months but then the soaker hose started to develop large leaks in different sections and at the nozzle. Eventually over half the hose wasn't getting water and finally the nozzle broke off. Just low quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: Good product but has limits.
customer_reviews.text: Good product but must be in a fairly straight line and make sure it does not twist. Not good for winding through a large bed like you would the hard sided soaker hoses.
customer_reviews.author: Kat E

customer_reviews.title: Well made....good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to wrap around my plants....so far only used it two times because it’s been raining every day.....well made....was so much better than me standing there with the hose.
customer_reviews.author: springchiknot

customer_reviews.title: Love my Soaker
customer_reviews.text: Used this to replace a similar but harder drip hose that was damaged during a tree removal. I am very happy with this as it is more flexible and is working out great.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with soaker hose
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3, hoping for good quality (because who can tell on line?!) and they are wonderful! I use them in my garden, and under the flowers on the side of the house. The hoses fit together well. The exterior isn't too porous - just right for gardening!
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Waters fantastically
customer_reviews.text: It’s great for soaking, but twisted up too easily. Works so well once installed properly that I’ve ordered more. I think it’s great actually
customer_reviews.author: survivor

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic soaker
customer_reviews.text: This soaker hose is terrific. Very durable. No kinks. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: Neat idea, but the female end leaks like crazy from the clamp area. Can't imagine this thing lasting more than a month even if it didn't leak.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S. Gargurevich

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: 5 of 5 hoses spray water or leak at the connection. no soaking downstream
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Kays

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these and laid them out for my newly planted foundation garden in the spring, and left them in place for the summer. They worked great for efficient watering. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Susan D.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This soaker hose is amazing. It’s easy to install and really puts out a lot of water all the way to the end of the hose
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: What can one say about a soaker hose? - ...
customer_reviews.text: What can one say about a soaker hose? - It arrived on time, I laid it out in the garden, hooked it up to a hose controlled by a timer, and now a few months later of mostly watching things grow, my tomatoes are "YUGE".
customer_reviews.author: Steeley

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Barely a drip coming out of these things. I don’t know where the water’s going, but it’s not on my plants! My old rubber soakers did a much better job - too bad they broke from dry rot.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Jerich

customer_reviews.title: Split after a month of use
customer_reviews.text: After a month of use, this soaker split with a one-inch breach, causing a loss in pressure for the section following the breach. Additional splits appear to be forming along other sections of the soaker. I am very disappointed in this product's durability and will not purchase this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Roderick Lee

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Multiple holes and leaks within two weeks of light use. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua B

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay, I guess.
customer_reviews.text: What I like is how compact you can make this hose however, this hose is absolutely garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Whoa_G82

customer_reviews.title: No leaks 2 months later :)
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is holding up well after about 2 months of being used a lot! No leaks :)
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Brendel

customer_reviews.title: Great soaker hose
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd Melnor flat soaker hose we've ordered this summer. They are lightweight and much easier to store than other hoses, and they're flexible and work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Z

customer_reviews.title: 0 stars
customer_reviews.text: Crapolla..... 1 month old and has several splits where water shoots out and shrubs go dry
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: This works well except for about a 4-5 foot expanse in the middle of the hose. It just doesn't release the same amount of water as the rest of the hose.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: this one is defective.
customer_reviews.text: with first use . well it has too much water in some parts and and too little in others.
customer_reviews.author: hippie

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome soaker house. I bought what I thought was a good one from Home Depot (Scott’s brand) and it was garbage. Major malfunction at the connections and wasted my time and a lot of water. Buy this one!
customer_reviews.author: R. Price

customer_reviews.title: Soaking wet
customer_reviews.text: This is great, works wonderful and doesn't snag while snaking through pants. The only problem I've had is remembering to turn the water off...
customer_reviews.author: Danno

customer_reviews.title: Melnor Soaker Hose Works Just as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have used recycled rubber and flat fabric soaker hoses before, and this brand has been the best. If you keep from allowing kinks in the hose, you'll have no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Folds flat
customer_reviews.text: Water flow is slower than I expected. Will suffice for my garden.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for soaking
customer_reviews.text: Great for watering the house foundation and plants close to house.
customer_reviews.author: Huskeratheart

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: 31 days after my purchase, one of the soaker hoses has developed two leaks and is no longer usable. I’ve used these hoses for years, but it appears their quality has deteriorated. Too bad, because I would have purchased more. Oh well....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make it Wet
customer_reviews.text: Gets things wet, had one with a pretty good leak near the end where the green hose clamp is. The water was shooting or but I just covered it with mulch and it still gets the ground wet as designed.
customer_reviews.author: Sientz

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough but only lasts a year or two in the AZ heat and sun.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: Product failed in two lengths. AGain no response to ...
customer_reviews.text: Product failed in two lengths. AGain no response to my email. The hoses tore open in several spots after 3 months of use, Wisconsin.
customer_reviews.author: Declan Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great product, does exactly what it is supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Great product, does exactly what it is supposed to, and is more flexible than I originally thought. Going to by another section to reach outer sections of flower garden.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie McCay

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Happy with the purchase. Hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Not good.
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I connect the water the hose started to leak close to the connector. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to be a bigger waste of water and even more time consuming.
customer_reviews.author: E.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Hose seems to be doing fine after a month. Looks and feels durable.
customer_reviews.author: Corrina

customer_reviews.title: Terrific soaker
customer_reviews.text: Great soaker hose - have two of the green ones that sprung leaks
customer_reviews.author: G. Greene

customer_reviews.title: flat...so easy to position, and fold up to store.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to soak my rose garden...easy to adjust water strength so it was slow enough to absorb and not run off.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Jennings

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: Leaking in middle of hose right out of box. My last hose at least lasted 1 season until it leaked.
customer_reviews.author: Laura S

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: This has leaked at the seams since the first day I used it. Little dots of water came out where it is stitched on the side but initially I thought that's normal because it's fabric and it was very minor but still useable. Well just about a month later after maybe 10 uses, about 2 feet of it is gushing water at the seams. I can't even return or exchange it because I am exactly 30days past the return window. Do not buy this, it will not last.
customer_reviews.author: DHJ

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery..still testing out if the entire hose is soaking evenly
customer_reviews.author: JLM

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great I get water where I need it and easy to install
customer_reviews.author: gary devier

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Soaker Hose!!!
customer_reviews.text: This hose provides even flow of water the entire 50' length of the hose. Something others don't always provide.
customer_reviews.author: Tony B.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This hose does not soak evenly!!! It gushed towards the end and dripped in a few spots in between.
customer_reviews.author: NE_mel

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: The hose works just fine, but for the long run that I’m using I think I would’ve been better off getting to 25 footers with a Y connection in the middle so that more pressure would get to the ends
customer_reviews.author: Pam Silver

customer_reviews.title: Great soaker hose
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the flat soaker hose for my garden. It works very well , at first is was a little slow, but after a few uses it workers very well. Great purchase, will purchase more.
customer_reviews.author: jab

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Works well and seems sturdy. I'm using two in raised vegetable gardens and they seem evenly watered. This hose is flat and much more flexible than my older tubular hose which was stiff and starting to crack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this soaker hose because I like the flat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this soaker hose because I like the flat, flexible design. It starting leaking about 1.5 months after I bought it. It now shoots water everywhere from the coupling and the first foot of the hose and no water makes it further down the soaker hose. As it failed just past the "warranty" I can no longer return it. I am a very dissatisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: JHC

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Horrible ! It leaked right out of the box the first time I used it! Had to throw it away. Never again! 😡
customer_reviews.author: Julie Cordier

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: Save yourself the trouble! Not only does it leak at EVERY SINGLE STICH but I’ve never had a hose kink so much in my entire life. This is the most frustrating hose EVER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis R.

customer_reviews.title: Not happy.
customer_reviews.text: Large holes developed after a few weeks rendering the whole thing useless.
customer_reviews.author: ER

customer_reviews.title: I like these soaker hoses
customer_reviews.text: I like these soaker hoses. I got 2 50 ft lengths instead of 4 25ft lengths this time - less connections. They're hooked up and working fine
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth F.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed and works great. It will stay in place all summer and ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed and works great. It will stay in place all summer and water 5 plantings. They are close together and the 50 feet was just right to circle each one once and connect to a hose.
customer_reviews.author: RC Marksman

customer_reviews.title: The first time I used it, there were literally ...
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used it, there were literally dozens of pinhole leaks. Because I bought it off-season and didn’t open it till months later, I couldn’t get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I tried to attach hose to spigot and hose broke came off in my hands. Waited a while before installing because we had a wet Spring and early Summer. Was past return time limit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is not the hose you are looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I think the reviews must be for a different hose than what they're selling here. First of all, it did NOT come with a cap on the end, so I had to attach a spray nozzle to it. Secondly, The hose does not emit water evenly. If you have raised beds and the hose travels across different elevations, all the water will drip down, none will get to plants between. It's truly terrible.
customer_reviews.author: A. Tig

customer_reviews.title: Best soaker hose at a great price
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the round, stuff rubber hoses you buy in the stores. Bought one and now ordering another.
customer_reviews.author: Hollie Murrin

customer_reviews.title: A DECENT SOAKER HOSE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hose to water some bamboo we put in, it did not work very well for this application but I've used them for other watering needs and they were fine. I recommended them to my landscaper and he likes them too. I took off a star because they've gone up in price for what they are. Good packaging and quick delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Mark KingTop Contributor: Bass Guitars & Gear

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these soaker hoses and two burst after about 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Traci Stafford

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is now my go to soaker hose. The others crack and wear out much too soon.
customer_reviews.author: JEMS

customer_reviews.title: A great hose.
customer_reviews.text: I like the hose,because you can move it around as well as run it through various plants without any problems.I would buy the same hose again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Best soaker hoses on the market
customer_reviews.text: These are THE BEST soaker hoses EVER! I have used them for years. I don't know about the knock off brands but Melnor is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: ljstx

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these hoses,  they do not last even 1 season
customer_reviews.text: I installed 3 of these soaker hoses at the end of may and they were leaking to the point of being unusable by mid august. I had to scrap the entire system and start over!!! Of course it was just a little too late to return the hoses.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used soaker hoses for years since they are so much more efficient. I needed new ones and tried these. They are wonderful! So much easier to use and a better quality. And even more efficient since I don't have lots of miscellaneous spray coming out of them. Plus I don't feel like I have to wrestle with them to get them in place. So glad to find them.
customer_reviews.author: Sue from NH

customer_reviews.title: I put it in my flower bed making it a easy hook up to water just the area
customer_reviews.text: It's a soaker hose, it does what it is suppose to do. I put it in my flower bed making it a easy hook up to water just the area. It does that well.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great hose! I use this for my squash and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great hose! I use this for my squash and fruit trees. The fabric makes it much more durable than the typical soaker hose.
customer_reviews.author: MMain

product_meta.title: Melnor Flat Soaker Garden Hose; 50 ft.
product_meta.description: Size:50 ft.| Color:BlackFlat Soaker Hose - 50'. Soaker hose is a great way to Be Water Wise, By slowly soaking only the areas you need, plants grow strong and lush with a minimum of run-off. Our Flat Soaker Hoses are easier to use than standard hoses which are hard to bend and even harder to store. The flat design rolls up tight to store in a small space and is available in three lengths; 25, 50 and 75 feet. Melnor was founded in the USA in 1946, two years later the first innovative Melnor oscillating sprinkler was introduced. While there have certainly been changes through the years, there has never been a change to our commitment to offer new and innovative ways for the home gardener to maintain lush yards and bountiful gardens. For more than sixty-years, Melnor has been a trusted partner to retailers and homeowners.
feature_bullets: Backed by a Melnor 2-Year Limited Warranty. Melnor stands behind its products. Need additional information or assistance? Leave a question/feedback below. We value your experience with us.
FLATTENS FOR EASY STORAGE - The compact design dripper only takes up about 0.05 ft³

EXTREMELY FLEXIBLE AND VERSATILE - It gets water right where you want it! You can place it above ground or under a thin layer of soil or mulch. The porous hose delivers soft and gentle watering with no waste. It's perfect for raised beds and vegetables!
EASY CONNECTION - Included rust-resistant end cap allows multiple hoses to be connected together
FITTING SIZE 3/4 INCH - Fits standard garden hose thread
